item.title: Lauri add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Until he extends the circle of his compassion to all living things, man will not himself find peace." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Hippocrates
item.description: "As to diseases, make a habit of two things â€” to help, or at least, to do no harm." -- Hippocrates

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Paul Harvey
item.description: "My nightmares relate all of man's inhumanity to man---to our willing acceptance of cruelty to the other animals. " -- Paul Harvey

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Man is the cruelest animal." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When the last living thing Has died on account of us, How poetical it would be If Earth could say, In a voice floating up Perhaps From the floor Of the Grand Canyon, "It is done." People did not like it here." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Ruth Harrison
item.description: "In fact, if one person is unkind to an animal it is considered to be cruelty, but where a lot of people are unkind to animals, especially in the name of commerce, the cruelty is condoned and, once large sums of money are at stake, will be defended to the last by otherwise intelligent people." -- Ruth Harrison

item.title: Lauri add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Lauri add a quote by John Raynolds
item.description: "Self-confidence is not taught or learned; it is earned by surpassing your own self-limitations." -- John Raynolds

item.title: Lauri add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Lauri add a quote by Lily Bollinger
item.description:
"I only drink champagne when I'm happy and when I'm sad. Sometimes I drink it when I'm alone. When I have company I consider it obligatory. I trifle with it if I'm not in a hurry and drink it when I am, otherwise I never touch the stuff unless I am thirsty.
" -- Lily Bollinger
